answers.answer: Hi,Antihypertensive medications may affect erection and urinary patterns.Are there any diuretics in your medications? Also how is your blood sugar levels? Diabetes may also present as polyuria or increased urinary frequency.A urinalysis may be able to help rule out any infection that may contribute to your symptoms.As with the erectile problems, you may discuss this with your physician prescriber. Erectile problems may also be due to other conditions like diabetes for instance.Psychological factors also need to be ruled out.

question: I am a 59 year old man in relatively good health except for high blood pressure which is under control with medication. I have to urinate frequently during the day and often at night. I have just had a prostate exam and my psa was normal and the prostate size was also normal. At night when I am lying on my back I find that just as I am going to sleep I have this urge to urinate. After I urinate I am fully awake again.If I lay on my side I don't have the urge to urinate as often but still several times a night anyway. Also my erections during sex isn't very good but the doctor seems to think that is because of the blood pressure medication. What do you think is wrong?
title: rivannaman
